plotShort.plainText:
Bleach: Thousand-Year Blood War (BLEACH 千年血戦篇, Burīchi: Sennen Kessen-hen), also known as Bleach: The Blood Warfare, is a Japanese anime television series based on the Bleach manga series by Tite Kubo and a direct sequel to the Bleach anime series. In March 2020, Weekly Shōnen Jump and "Bleach 20th Anniversary Project & Tite Kubo New Project Presentation" livestream announced that the manga's last story arc, "Thousand-Year Blood War", would receive an anime project. In November 2020, it was announced that the anime project would be a television series. The trailer and visual for the series were revealed at the Jump Festa '22 in December 2021.
The series is directed by Tomohisa Taguchi and premiered on TV Tokyo in October 2022. The series will run for four cours with breaks in between. The first cour, The Thousand-Year Blood War, consists of 13 episodes and ended in December of the same year. The second cour, subtitled The Separation, will begin airing on July 8, 2023.
Tatsuya Kitani performed the opening theme "Scar" (スカー, Sukā), while SennaRin performed the ending theme "Saihate" (最果て, "The Farthest Reaches"); In addition, Kitani also performed the special ending theme for the first episode, "Rapport", which was previously used as the main theme song for the series' 20th Anniversary Exhibition, Bleach EX. For The Separation cour, the opening theme is "Stars" by w.o.d.
In October 2022, Viz Media announced that the series would stream on Hulu in the United States and Disney+ internationally outside of Asia; Viz Media's English dub of the series began streaming on Hulu in November of the same year.

Part 1: The Thousand-Year Blood War
3671"The Blood Warfare"Tomohisa TaguchiHikaru MurataTomohisa TaguchiOctober 11, 2022
Soul Reapers Ryūnosuke Yuki and Shino Madarame are assigned as new guardians of Karakura Town, following the mass disappearances of Hollows from the Human World. They are ambushed by Hollows, but rescued by Ichigo Kurosaki, Orihime Inoue, Yasutora Sado and Uryū Ishida. Two days later, Ichigo meets Asguiaro Ebern, a member of the Wandenreich. When Ebern attempts to use a Quincy medallion to seal Ichigo's Bankai, he destroys it and makes him retreat. At the same time, a group of individuals representing the Wandenreich, the Quincy Empire, ambush head captain Genryūsai Shigekuni Yamamoto's office in the Soul Society, and deliver a fatal wound to lieutenant Chōjirō Sasakibe as an example of the impending fate of the Soul Reapers. Meanwhile, 11th squad members Ikkaku Madarame and Yumichika Ayasegawa investigate the disappearances of thousands of civilians from the Rukon District. At the Wandenreich's base Silbern, Ebern delivers a report to Yhwach, the Quincy King.
3682"Foundation Stones"Tomohisa TaguchiMitsutoshi SatoTomohisa TaguchiOctober 18, 2022
Nelliel Tu Odelschwanck and Pesche go to the Human World, and inform Ichigo that Hueco Mundo has been overthrown by the Wandenreich, after Tier Hallibel was defeated by Yhwach. The Arrancars of Hueco Mundo have either joined the Quincies, been killed or were enslaved. Kisuke Urahara, Ichigo, Orihime, Chad, Nel and Pesche arrive to Hueco Mundo. Meanwhile, the Wandenreich's hunting captain of the First Jagdarmee, Quilge Opie (Stern Ritter "J", "The Jail"), tests the Arrancars to see who can join their ranks. Loly and Menoly attempt to take an upper hand, but are dispatched easily. Tres Bestias: Emilou Apacci, Franceska Mila Rose and Cyan Sung-Sun arrive, and kill many Quincy soldiers, but are overwhelmed by Quilge. Ichigo decides to free all Arrancars.
3693"March of the StarCross"Hikaru YamaguchiHodaka KuramotoTomohisa TaguchiOctober 25, 2022
Ichigo begins his fight against Quilge. The Tres Bestias summon Ayon and re-join the fight against Quilge. Uryu learns the truth of the conflict between Soul Reapers and Quincies centuries ago. It is revealed that 12th Division captain Mayuri Kurotsuchi ordered his division to exterminate the civilians from the Rukon District, in order to rectify the soul imbalance caused by the Quincies exterminating Hollows in the Living World. It is revealed that Yamamoto failed to stop Yhwach 1000 years ago. Quilge absorbs Reishi in the area (including from Ayon) and overpowers the Tres Bestias, but clashes with Ichigo once again after he activates his Bankai, all the while the Quincies have begun their invasion of the Soul Society, with Bazz-B mortally wounding Lieutenant of Squad 3 Izuru Kira and brutally killing the seat officers of Squad 3.
3704"Kill The Shadow"Hikaru MurataHikaru MurataTomohisa TaguchiNovember 1, 2022
Over 1000 Soul Reapers die within the Quincy's invasion. 3rd Division captain Rōjūrō "Rose" Ōtoribashi meets Stern Ritter "U" NaNaNa Najahkoop, 6th Division captain Byakuya Kuchiki and lieutenant Renji Abarai against Stern Ritter "F" Äs Nödt and Stern Ritter "S" Mask De Masculine, 7th Division captain, and Sajin Komamura on Stern Ritter "E" Bambietta Basterbine. The other Soul Society captains face off against un-named Stern Ritters. As the fighting reaches a stalemate, the 2nd Division captain Soi-Fon, 6th, 7th and 10th Division captain Tōshirō Hitsugaya release their Bankais, but have them immediately stolen by their opponent Stern Ritters using absorbing medallions. The captains are shocked of the news that the Stern Ritters' trump card is to steal Bankai, as it is communicated to the rest of the Soul Society. 8th Division captain, Shunsui Kyōraku is blinded in his right eye by Robert Accutrone. Meanwhile, Quilge continues his fight against Ichigo and Urahara observes that the Stern Ritter is having difficulties stealing Ichigo's Bankai. Urahara reveals the portal for Ichigo to enter there and join the fight. In a last ditch effort, Quilge attacks Urahara, Orihime and Sado, and uses his Stern Ritter powers ("The Jail") to imprison Ichigo, while he is in the Garganta and on his way to the Soul Society.
3715"Wrath as a Lightning"Mitsutoshi SatoMitsutoshi SatoMasaki HiramatsuNovember 8, 2022
Ichigo hears the voices of many Soul Reapers, while desperately trying to escape from Quilge's Jail. Before Quilge can kill Urahara and the others, he is killed by an unseen assailant. Byakuya and Renji engage Äs Nödt in battle. Byakuya is unnerved by Äs, who awakened his fears with Reishi Thorns. Byakuya attempts to overcome his fear, but Äs overwhelms him with his own Bankai. Rukia and Renji are wounded by other Stern Ritters. Zaraki, having killed three of them, confronts Yhwach and his right hand man, Jugram Haschwalth. As 9th division lieutenant Shūhei Hisagi is about to be defeated by Stern Ritter "O", Driscoll Berci, head captain Yamamoto steps in. Driscoll reveals that he killed Sasakibe and stole his Bankai, Kōkō Gonryō Rikyū, with which he attacks the head captain. This reminds Yamamoto of the first time Sasakibe showed him his Bankai, 2,000 years ago. Yamamoto kills Driscoll, saves Zaraki from Yhwach and inspires the Soul Reapers to fight again.
3726"The Fire"Tomohisa TaguchiEma SaitōMasaki HiramatsuNovember 15, 2022
Yamamoto engages Yhwach in battle across the rooftops of the Seireitei. After Yhwach is pushed to unsheathing his sword, Yamamoto activates his Bankai, Zanka no Tachi, which causes everything to dry up without water. 4th division captain Retsu Unohana and her lieutenant Isane Kotetsu are worried that if the battle goes on for too long, Yamamoto could destroy even the Soul Society. Yhwach is powerless against the various abilities of Zanka no Tachi, and Yamamoto boasts that his Bankai is too strong to be stolen. Yamamoto unknowingly defeats the fake replica and identifies it as Stern Ritter "Y- Yourself" Royd Lloyd. Yhwach destroys the Division 1 barracks and kills Royd for his failure. Yhwach reveals he was busy meeting with Sōsuke Aizen in his underground prison. Considered by the Wandenreich to be one of the Five Special War Powers, Yhwach attempted to recruit Aizen, but he refused to join him, not wanting him to fall under his command, so he was left in prison. Yamamoto attempts to use his Bankai again, but Yhwach steals it, being the only one actually powerful enough to take it and kills him.
3737"Born in the Dark"Toshiyuki TsuruShin'ichirō UedaMasaki HiramatsuNovember 22, 2022
A thousand years ago, the original Thirteen Court Guard Squads consisted of ruthless and barbaric killers without shared purpose, partook in slaughtering the Wandenreich, and Yamamoto and Sasakibe personally defeated Yhwach. Afterwards, Yamamoto adopted a peaceful philosophy and formed a unified Court Guard system. Back in the present day, Yhwach destroys Yamamoto's remains. Ichigo breaks free and Byakuya asks him to save everyone. Ichigo trades blows with Yhwach's Reishi Sword using Getsuga Tenshō, but is quickly defeated. Yhwach attempts to stab Ichigo in the neck, but is countered by a defensive Quincy technique called Blut Vene. Yhwach reveals Quilge's Jail can only be broken by a Quincy and deduces that Ichigo doesn't know the truth about himself or his mother. Shadow portals appear to transport the Quincy back to Silbern and Yhwach realizes that Aizen used his shikai on him to lose track of time. Ichigo tries to charge at Yhwach, but his Zanpakutō is destroyed by Jugram. Yhwach departs cryptically referring to the stunned Ichigo as "his son, born in the dark".
3748"The Shooting Star Project (Zero Mix)"Shinji ItadakiYoung Hoon JungMasaki HiramatsuNovember 29, 2022
After the invasion, Rukia and Renji are treated by Division 4, along with the surviving Soul Reapers as Byakuya barely clings to life. Mayuri tells Ichigo that as his Zanpakutō was destroyed while in Bankai state, it cannot be fixed. The captains mourn Yamamoto, Byakuya and Zaraki are still in a critical state and may never wake. Ichigo and the captains meet with Squad Zero, composed of five most elite former captains, who protect the Soul King in the Royal Palace. Ichigo and the captains talk to Urahara, Orihime and Chad, who were saved from Quilge by a concealed Grimmjow Jaegerjaquez. Kūkaku Shiba sends Ichigo, Byakuya, Renji, Rukia and Squad Zero to the Royal Palace above the Seireitei, where Zangetsu could be reforged. Kūkaku, having sent them up to the Royal Palace, joins her brother Ganju, Kūgo Ginjō, Shūkurō Tsukishima and Giriko Kutsuzawa, who now reside in the Soul Society, since they were killed with a Zanpakutō. At the Royal Palace, Ichigo, Rukia, Renji and Byakuya, are being healed by Tenjirō Kirinji, a member of Squad Zero and the one who taught Unohana healing techniques. The Soul King is seen awakening.
3759"The Drop"Kaito AsakuraKaito AsakuraMasaki HiramatsuDecember 6, 2022
Ichigo and Renji are healed completely by Kirinji, and they move up to Kirio Hikifune's palace, where they are quickly fed all sorts of ancient Soul Society dishes, filled with strong spiritual pressure, before being sent up to Ōetsu Nimaiya's palace, the man who created all Zanpakutō. Meanwhile, captain Kyōraku is appointed as new head captain and he selects his lieutenant Nanao Ise to come join him as a lieutenant in the 1st Division, whilst also promoting Yamamoto's previous 3rd Seat, Genshiro Okikiba to lieutenant. He decrees that Zaraki is to be taught "zanjutsu" - an all-style encompassing swordsmanship by 4th Division captain Unohana, who reveals herself a criminal for the history of the Soul Society and the founder of the 11th Division and the first Kenpachi, her real name being Yachiru Unohana. Unohana and Zaraki fight in the infinite underground prison, Muken. Zaraki recalls how he used to admire Unohana, from their first meeting on, when he scarred her chest. Unohana states that he has become far weaker from then and she will push him to the brink of death and revive him repeatedly to unlock his full potential.
37610"The Battle"Hikaru MurataHikaru MurataMasaki HiramatsuDecember 13, 2022
Hundreds of years ago, Unohana has grown bored of slaughtering bandits in the hopes of finding a worthy opponent, until a vicious child, Zaraki attacks her. Unohana is overpowered, so Zaraki subconsciously begins to hold himself back, which ends in his defeat. Back in the present day, Unohana wounds Zaraki hundreds of times, as he grows stronger each time he resurrects. She unleashes her Bankai, Minazuki, which allows her to extend her blade with acidic slashes resembling blood. Zaraki has grown strong enough to power through and kill her. As he grieves Unohana, he finally gets to speak with his Zanpakutō and forge bond. Meanwhile, Ichigo, Renji and Kon arrive in Nimaiya's palace, Hoohden, where they meet countless Zanpakutō spirits and the unconventional captain himself. Nimaiya teaches them about the basics of how Soul Reapers receive Zanpakutō in their base form, called Asauchi, which becomes a personalized Zanpakutō the more the wielder imprints his soul pressure on it. Nimaiya sends the two down into a hole filled with countless Asauchi and leaves them there for three days to fight them. Renji comes out victorious, with an Asauchi having chosen him, but Ichigo fails the test. Nimaiya unceremoniously sends Ichigo back to the Human World, right in front of the Kurosaki clinic, citing that he needs to return to his roots, since he did not go through traditional Asauchi training.
37711"Everything But the Rain"Mitsutoshi SatoHikaru Murata,
Yūsaku Kikuchi		Masaki HiramatsuDecember 20, 2022
Nimaiya tells Renji, that he created every single Zanpakutō for the last several thousand years, including Zaraki's, which he actually stole off of a Soul Reaper's dead body, adding that Ichigo's was not an Asauchi made by him, therefore his training would have never worked. Ichigo visits the shop, where Ikumi Unagiya comforts him, before Isshin Kurosaki arrives in his Soul Reaper attire to take Ichigo away, though Ichigo unknowingly leaves his badge behind. Isshin tells Ichigo about the history of their family, while to Ichigo that his mother was a Quincy. Nearly twenty years ago, when Isshin Shiba was still captain of Division 10, a series of mysterious Soul Reaper deaths began occurring in Naraki City. Isshin went out to investigate the cause, which turned out to be an immensely powerful and intelligent Hollow, clad in black armor and made from the mixture of several dead Soul Reapers' souls, which is where it gets its name "White". Elsewhere, Masaki Kurosaki, an Echt Quincy noble who was taken in by Sōken Ishida's family after the demise of her own, sensed the Spiritual Pressure released by the Hollow and Isshin, and headed off to help, despite Ryūken and the lower ranked Gemischt Quincy family maid Kanae Katagiri attempting to dissuade her. While fighting the Hollow, Isshin attempted to use his Bankai, but was slashed in the back by the creators of this Hollow, Aizen, Gin Ichimaru and Kaname Tōsen. Masaki arrived and saved Isshin, while Aizen stopped Tōsen from killing her, due to finding her intriguing. Masaki used herself as bait to draw the Hollow close and kill it in one blow, initiating its self destruction which Isshin shielded Masaki from. Masaki healed Isshin's wounds, while also revealing herself to be a Quincy. Initially fearing his reaction, she rejoiced, when Isshin gladly declared, that he was happy to have met a living Quincy. Ryūken and Kanae, seeing that she found safety, decided to leave her be and headed off together. Back in the present day, Jugram meets Uryū.
37812"Everything But the Rain "June Truth""Kentarō Tokiwa,
Shinji Itadaki		Young Hoon JungMasaki HiramatsuDecember 27, 2022
Continuing his story to Ichigo, Isshin reported back to Yamamoto about his successful mission, but left out Masaki from his report. Feeling drawn to her, he returned to the Human World on patrol. Since the attack of the White Hollow, Masaki has started to feel dazed and pulled down into the darkness by the hollow soul which merged with her. As she was berated by Ryūken's mother for helping a Soul Reaper, she collapsed and a hollow hole appeared on her chest. Ryūken picked her up and ran off for help, running into Isshin and blaming him for Masaki's condition. Urahara, who has briefly met with Masaki before, then stepped into their conflict and told them that he knows of a way to help her, which he discovered during the last one hundred years of exile, while trying to cure the Visoreds. Due to her being an extremely powerful Echt Quincy merged with a hollow, the solution for her cure would be different, than for a Soul Reaper merged with one. To balance her soul out with the hollow's in her, the entirety of a Soul Reaper's power is needed to combat it for her entire life, since a Quincy does not have any resistance to hollow souls. Isshin volunteered and Urahara provided him with a specially created Gigai, that can completely contain a Soul Reaper soul and turn them into a human. Afterwards, the two settled down together and fell in love, while Ryūken married Katagiri. Isshin then tells Ichigo, that the reason Masaki died fighting Grand Fisher and Katagiri died from her illness, was because according to ancient Quincy texts, Yhwach used the Auswählen that stripped several of his people of their powers to regain his own 9 years ago, deeming them impure. Before heading off again, Ichigo receives his badge back from Ikumi. Ryūken finds evidence of Uryū meeting with the Stern Ritters.
37913"The Blade Is Me"Tomohisa TaguchiTomohisa Taguchi,
Mitsutoshi Sato,
Yoshinori Odaka		Masaki HiramatsuDecember 27, 2022
One of Nimaiya's Zanpakutō bodyguards immediately retrieves Ichigo and places him with the countless Asauchi again, to fight until one chooses him. However, all the Asauchi kneel to Ichigo as he chooses a white Asauchi, the hollow "White" inside him. In Soul Society, the captains and lieutenants begin training. Captain Hitsugaya returns to the Soul Reaper training grounds to hone his sword-wielding skills. 9th division captain, Kensei Muguruma takes his lietenant, Hisagi out to face his other, unofficial lieutenant Mashiro Kuna in her Hollowfied form, in order to awaken his Bankai. Akon returns to the division 12 barracks after his wounds have been treated and learns that captain Kurotsuchi and lieutenant Nemu Kurotsuchi have locked themselves in the lab for more than 24 hours now and are in the process of creating something. Captain Komamura returns to his clan's hideout and tries to convince the clan elder to teach him a secret clan technique, while captain Soi-Fon trains her body in the mountains. Meanwhile, Nimaiya's bodyguards prepare the forge and he begins rebuilding Ichigo's Zanpakutō, while also telling him that Old Man Zangetsu is not his Zanpakutō, the hollow "White" in him was his Zanpakutō all along, and that Old Man Zangetsu was actually the source of Ichigo's latent Quincy powers, taking the form of Yhwach from a thousand years ago. Ichigo speaks to Old Man Zangetsu again, who expresses pride in how strong Ichigo has become since he chose the path of a Soul Reaper, despite Old Man Zangetsu suppressing his powers to prevent him from becoming a Soul Reaper in the first place. Old Man Zangetsu sheds a tear as he says farewell and relinquishes his hold on Ichigo's powers, allowing him to finally access his true Zanpakutō, the dual bladed Zangetsu. Sensing both "White" and Old Man Zangetsu in the long and short blades respectively, Ichigo thanks Zangetsu and says that you are me. In Silbern, Yhwach meets with Haschwalth, who has brought Uryū along, donned in Stern Ritter attire.
